Explanation

In this page, we explain the uncertainty estimation and the visualizations we have used in this evaluation tool.

Our simulation generates many possible variations of the same fiber tract (i.e., originated from the same seed-point). You can think about it, as perfoming the scan and tractography multiple times and capturing the variations in the results. These variations in the fiber tract arises due to the underlying uncertainty sources present in the pipeline.

For example, in clinical laboratory, a single test is performed to get one result, e.g., 0.3 mg/L (shown with a green dot). Similarly, a fiber is obtained from a single scan (shown with a green line).

As, in the clinical laboratory, a specific test is performed multiple times, and the result is determined based on a statistical mean or median (red dot). Similarly, multiple fiber samples are obtained from our simulation. We compute the representative fiber, which is the median of the distribution (red tube)

A range of variance can be selected, for example, to remove the outliers. Here, 75% variance is selected for the visualization from the distribution.
